proper noun.description: An organization under the Soviet regime for the investigation of counterrevolutionary activities. It executed many real and alleged enemies of Lenin's regime from its formation in 1917 until 1922 when it was replaced by the OGPU.

origin: Russian, from che, ka, the initial letters of Chrezvychaĭnaya komissiya Extraordinary Commission (for combating Counter-revolution, Sabotage, and Speculation).
